result.execSummary:
The defendant Darrick E. Hayes was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct. This is not a criminal offense and results only in a money penalty for this offense.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Darrick E. Hayes

records.addlTxt:
Clerk: Amanda. 
Case Called at 2:03 pm.
State appears by ADA Davis Runde.  Defendant is not present, but Attorney Rohloff appears on his behalf.  
VRCW.  
State moves to AMEND Ct.1(DC/Domestic Abuse) to County Ordinance DC, pursuant to 9.21; 

COURT GRANTS ABOVE.

PLEA to Ct.1(DC)>>NO CONTEST entered by Attorney Rohloff. 

COURT advises Attorney Rohloff to learn defendant of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & questions defendant to understanding; 

COURT ORDERS: Pay forfeiture of $5+CC. 

Adj: 2:06 pm.
Final pre-trial on April 22, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Calendar call on February 10, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

records.addlTxt:
Pre-trial conference on January 31, 2022 at 08:40 am.
Final pre-trial on April 27, 2022 at 08:40 am.
Jury Trial on May 24, 2022 at 09:00 am.

No contact with victim(s): A.N.H.  Contact includes direct personal or physical and indirect contact by phone, in writing of any kind, entry to the person's residence or place of employment together with contacts through other persons.  Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney.  Police escort to retrieve personal property from the residence.  Report to ATTIC Corrections Services (715-848-3202) within one business day of release. Comply with pretrial monitoring through ATTIC Correctional Services at Level (1) supervision with possible drug testing as determined by agency screening.

Clerk: Amanda.
Case called at 2:28 pm.
State appears by ADA Cody Marschall. Defendant appears from MCJ, and with Attorney Trevor Peterson.
Date and Time set for IA; VRCW. 

Reading Waived.  Reserve Jurisdiction. 
Court questions deft re: complaint and rights.
Advised Right of Counsel. 

PLEA:  NOT GUILTY.

COURT ORDERS: $500 signature bond - CONDITIONS: 
- No contact with victim(s): A.N.H. or residence. Contact includes direct personal or physical and indirect contact by phone, in writing of any kind, entry to the person's residence or place of employment together with contacts through other persons.  Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney.
- Police escort to retrieve personal property from the residence. 
- Report to ATTIC Corrections Services within one business day of release.Comply with pretrial monitoring through ATTIC Correctional Services at Level 1 supervision with possible drug testing as determined by agency screening.
